rationale: 'highly contagious bird flu' uses 'highly contagious' as a technical term preceding the virus name.
statement_text: From Wyoming to Maine, an outbreak of the highly contagious bird flu has swept across farms and backyard flocks in the United States this year, prompting millions of chickens and turkeys to be culled.

rationale: The verb 'swept across' is combined with scale/impact ('across farms and backyard flocks', 'millions...to be culled').
statement_text: From Wyoming to Maine, an outbreak of the highly contagious bird flu has swept across farms and backyard flocks in the United States this year, prompting millions of chickens and turkeys to be culled.
